'''Matthew 3:6''' is the sixth verse of the third chapter of the [[Gospel of Matthew]] in the [[New Testament]]. The verse occurs in the section introducing [[John the Baptist]] with this verse describing his [[baptism]]s. In the [[King James Version]] of the Bible the text reads: :And were baptized of him in :Jordan, confessing their sins. The [[World English Bible]] translates the passage as: :They were baptized by him in :the Jordan, confessing their sins. For a collection of other versions see here: {{Bibleverse||Matthew|3:6|1000}} The use of the word [[baptism]] to describe what John is doing is controversial. [[Anabaptist]]s assert that the only proper translation for the Greek verb ''baptizmo'' is ''immerse''. They thus practice baptisms where the entire body is immersed in water, rather than just a sprinkling of water as is done in most other Christian churches. Most non-Baptist scholars do agree that John the Baptist was probably immersing those that came to see him, but they disagree that this is the only valid form of baptism. France notes that while in Luke and Mark John's baptisms have the power to forgive sins in Matthew they are merely confessed. France argues that in the Gospel of Matthew forgiveness of sins only becomes possible after Jesus' resurrection, a theology not held by the other synoptics.France, R.T. ''The Gospel According to Matthew: an Introduction and Commentary.'' Leicester: Inter-Varsity, 1985. The wording of this verse gives no guidance to the Protestant/Catholic dispute over whether the act of baptism cleanses one of sins, or if it merely symbolizes that a person has already been cleansed by God. Similarly the verse is unclear on what role [[confession (religion)|confession]] plays in the process.France, R.T. ''The Gospel According to Matthew: an Introduction and Commentary.'' Leicester: Inter-Varsity, 1985. pg. 107 The origins of John's baptism ritual are much discussed amongst scholars. Hill notes that various forms of baptism were practiced throughout the Jewish world at this time, but that only those of John the Baptist and [[Qumran]] are [[eschatological]]. This has many scholars to propose a link between the Baptist and those who wrote the [[Dead Sea Scrolls]]. There were still important difference between the baptisms of the [[Essenes]] and that of John. In Qumran baptism was a part of a regular ritual for those already purified. In John and in Christianity it is a one time event with transformative powers.Hill, David. ''The Gospel of Matthew''. Grand Rapids: Eerdmans, 1981 ==References== {{reflist}} {{sequence | prev = [[Matthew 3:5]] | list = [[Gospel of Matthew]]
[[Matthew 3|Chapter 3]] | next = [[Matthew 3:7]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Matthew 03:06}} {{Matthew 3}} [[Category:Matthew 3|03:06]] [[Category:Baptism]]

{{Infobox aviator | name = Mikhail Farikh | image = MishaFarikh-n-granddad2016.jpg | image_size = 300px | alt = | caption = Michael points at his grandfather's photo. [[Naryan-Mar Airport]] April 18, 2016 | full_name = Mikhail Rostislavovich Farikh | native_name = Фарих Михаил Ростиславович | native_name_lang = ru | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1959|06|06}} | birth_place = Moscow, Russia | death_date = {{Death date and age|2016|04|18|1959|06|06}} | death_place = {{coord|73|19|40|N|69|59|37|E|display=inline,title}} — [[Bely Island]], Russia | death_cause = Air accident | resting_place = [[Novodevichy Cemetery]], Russia | resting_place_coordinates = <!-- {{Coord|LATITUDE|LONGITUDE|type:landmark}} --> | monuments = | nationality = Russian | education = High | spouse = Eugenia Farikh | relatives = | known_for = first Russian to go around the world by helicopter | first_flight_date = | first_flight_aircraft = | famous_flights = | license_date = | license_place = | first_race = <!-- For racing aviators --> | racing_best = <!-- For racing aviators --> | racing_aircraft = <!-- For racing aviators --> | website = {{URL|https://youtube.com/user/9697873}} | child = Eugenia Farikh | module = }} '''Mikhail Rostislavovich Farikh''' (Russian: Фарих Михаил Ростиславович) (June 6 1959, Moscow — April 18 2016 [[Bely_Island|Bely]]) was a private helicopter pilot and the first Russian to go around the world by helicopter and to reach the North Pole. He held world records in helicopter competitions. He helped popularize light aviation and was a prominent activist in the world of Russian [[General aviation|GA]]. He was also an active member of the aviation organization {{ill|AOPA Russia|ru|АОПА-Россия}}.
== Biography == He was born in Moscow in 1959 into the family of test pilot Rostislav Fabiovich Farikh born May 12, 1922. His grandfather Fabio Farikh was a prominent polar pilot and a motoring pioneer in Russia.
In 1976, Mikhail graduated from Moscow School No. 10. He entered the law faculty of the Military Institute of the Ministry of Defense (which is now, after several transformations, part of the MU RF MD), from which he graduated in 1980.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clubvi.ru/birthday/13.htm|title=Перечень дней рождений и кафедр выпускников ВИМО|publisher=Клуб товарищей ВИИЯ Красной армии|author=|date=|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sGv0t60m?url=http://www.clubvi.ru/birthday/13.htm|archivedate=27 July 2017|accessdate=27 July 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> He served in the armed forces as a legal officer until 1995. He retired with the rank of lieutenant-colonel.<ref name="nomination2013"/>
After being discharged into the reserves, he went into the automobile audio equipment business.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.popmech.ru/made-in-russia/5651-poyushchie-dinozavry-stalnye-glotki/|title=Поющие динозавры: Стальные глотки|publisher=Популярная механика|author=Корзинов Николай|date=27 August 2006|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170420194813/http://www.popmech.ru/made-in-russia/5651-poyushchie-dinozavry-stalnye-glotki/|archivedate=20 April 2017|accessdate=20 April 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> He was fond of multi-discipline car audio competitions and in 2006 became the Russian champion in EMMA racing, in which driving skills as well as car audio and tuning are put to the test.
After giving up his active role in business, Mikhail enrolled in cooking courses, studied Italian,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://rusrep.ru/article/2015/07/09/aviaprobegom--po-bezdorozhyu/ |title= Авиапробегом по бездорожью |publisher= Русский репортёр |author= Цырулева Мария |date= 9 July 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420194943/http://rusrep.ru/article/2015/07/09/aviaprobegom--po-bezdorozhyu/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> and then ended up by chance in a flying club, where he began to study flying at {{nobr|the age of 48<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPMubXfrk_s Выпуск №2] телепрограмма PilotTV (22 февраля 2011).</ref>}}
== Mobile Sound Systems == [[File: Prolozavr_car.jpg|thumb|Prolozavr demo car]]
Mikhail Farikh made a valuable contribution to the recent history of Russian and international mobile sound-system design and all-terrain vehicles.<ref name=amtrussia>{{cite web |url= http://amt-russia.ru/18_aprelya_2016_goda__na_57-om_godu_zhizni_tragicheski_pogib_Generalnyj_direktor_ZAO_%C2%ABFirma_%C2%ABMMS%C2%BB_Farih_Mihail_Rostislavovich. |title= 18 апреля 2016 года на 57-ом году жизни трагически погиб Генеральный директор ЗАО «Фирма «ММС» Фарих Михаил Ростиславович. |publisher= Национальная Ассоциация Соревнований по Автозвуку, Мультимедиа, Тюнингу |author= |date= 3 May 2016 |archiveurl= https://www.webcitation.org/6sGvtybxH?url=http://amt-russia.ru/18_aprelya_2016_goda__na_57-om_godu_zhizni_tragicheski_pogib_Generalnyj_direktor_ZAO_%C2%ABFirma_%C2%ABMMS%C2%BB_Farih_Mihail_Rostislavovich. |archivedate= 27 July 2017 |accessdate= 27 July 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> The projects he headed attracted great attention at car audio competitions, exhibitions, and social events. In sound-pressure level (SPL) competitions between 2001 and 2007, Team Prology took first place 48 times and second place twice and set 14 Russian records. The absolute Russian record of 173.4 dB, set in 2003 with the car named “Ladoga,” has yet to be surpassed.<ref>{{cite magazine |last= |first= |date=December 2003 |issue=11 |volume=27 |pages=124—129|title=Битва гигантов |trans-title=Battle of giants |url= |language=Russian |magazine=Car&Music |location= |publisher= |access-date= }}</ref>
He helped to develop and build a number of mobile audio complexes (Hurricane, Typhoon, JBL Sound Cruiser, Prolozavr 1.0 and 2.0).<ref>{{cite journal |title=Перекуем ракеты на сабвуферы |type= журнал |edition=Мастер 12 вольт |date=June 2004 |pages=20—21}}</ref> The JBL Sound Cruiser test car made a great impression at the 2005 IFA in Berlin and received worldwide acclaim.<ref>{{cite journal |title=Russishe revolution |edition=Sound off |date=January 2006 |pages=92—95 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |title=Саунд трак |type=еженедельная автомобильная газета |edition=МК Мобиль |date=June 2005 |page=30 |quote=13}}</ref>
== Flight Activity == [[File:Pilot R44 Michael Farikh. R44 RA-04264 (13978107095).jpg|thumb|Mikhail in flight, aboard his [[Robinson R44|R44]]]] Mikhail began to learn to fly helicopters in 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://snob.ru/profile/5009/print/79621 |title= Михаил Фарих, который полетел |publisher= Сноб |author= Татьяна Хрылова |date= 12 August 2014 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420195123/https://snob.ru/profile/5009/print/79621 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Mikhail Farikh, Who Flies Like an Eagle (55)|url=http://www.theageofhappiness.com/posts/mikhail-farikh-who-flies-like-aneagle-55|website=The Age Of Happiness Project|accessdate=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6u5ZsXrCM?url=http://www.theageofhappiness.com/posts/mikhail-farikh-who-flies-like-aneagle-55/14caddc8388|archivedate=9 October 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> In 2008, he acquired his private pilot license. He immediately began flying frequently and extensively. He acquired a British pilot license in the same year, and an American one in 2010.
In subsequent years, he continued to increase his qualifications by attending courses at various domestic and foreign flying clubs (in England, Spain, the USA, Canada, etc.),<ref name="nomination2013">{{cite web |url= http://www.helicopter.su/meropriyatiya/premiya_avi/2013/pilot_sportsmen/farix_mixail_rostislavovich.html |title= Премия АВИ за 2013 год » Пилот-спортсмен » Фарих Михаил Ростиславович |publisher= Ассоциация вертолётной индустрии |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420195221/http://www.helicopter.su/meropriyatiya/premiya_avi/2013/pilot_sportsmen/farix_mixail_rostislavovich.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> and was constantly improving his technique, paying special attention to [[autorotation|autorotation landings]]. The [[Robinson R44]] and [[Robinson R66]] were Mikhail’s main helicopters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kommersant.ru/doc/2185201|title=Полёты уровня VIP|publisher=[[Коммерсантъ]]|author=Веретенников Иван|date=15 May 2013|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20170420195458/http://kommersant.ru/doc/2185201|archivedate=20 April 2017|accessdate=20 April 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref>
{{Verse translation |lang=russian | Однако, гены действительно существуют, и уже в совершенно зрелом возрасте 48-летним пенсионером я пришёл в авиаклуб учиться летать. На вертолёте. Почему на вертолёте? Да просто вертодром находится рядом с моей дачей. Если бы рядом был аэродром, я бы стал летать на самолёте или на планере — но летать бы начал непременно.<ref>{{cite book |author=Фарих Фабио, Даксергоф Игорь |chapter=Предисловие |title=Над снегами |edition=переиздание 1932 г. |location=Moscow |year=2014 |publisher=ЛитРес (оригинал — Молодая гвардия, ОГИЗ) |page=3}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |author=Веселов Михаил |url=http://nvinder.ru/article/vypusk-no-42-20387-ot-26-aprelya-2016-g/13080-posledniy-polet |title=Последний полет |edition=Няръяна вындер |date=April 2016 |volume=20387 |number=42 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20170426193603/http://nvinder.ru/article/vypusk-no-42-20387-ot-26-aprelya-2016-g/13080-posledniy-polet |archive-date=26 April 2017 |quote=26 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>|attr1=Mikhail Farikh|However, genes do exist and, being of quite a mature age, a pensioner of 48, I went to the flying club to start flight training. Helicopters. Why helicopters? Simply because there was a heliport near my summer house. If it had been an airfield, I would be flying airplanes or gliders, but I would still have started, without a doubt.|attr2=Translated by wikipedians}}
Mikhail’s intense flight activity is proved by the hours he logged — without performing commercial flights or training student pilots, Mikhail flew 332 hours in 2011<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.helicopter.su/meropriyatiya/premiya_avi/2011/pilot/farix_mixail_rostislavovich.html |title= Премия АВИ за 2011 год » Пилот » Фарих Михаил Ростиславович |publisher= Ассоциация вертолётной индустрии |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420195344/http://www.helicopter.su/meropriyatiya/premiya_avi/2011/pilot/farix_mixail_rostislavovich.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> (a total of 1,340 hours as of 2011) and 425 hours in 2013 (altogether 2,113 hours).<ref name="nomination2013" /> He flew more than 2,100 hours in the six years after he began training. Later Mikhail also mastered flying airplanes and received a “Single-engine land-based plane” entry in his pilot license. He also flew gliders and other types of aircraft.<ref name=Mishaplanesolo>{{cite web |url= http://saon.ru/forum/viewtopic.php?p=118241#p118241 |title= Личные записи Михаила на форуме SAON.RU |publisher= Фарих Михаил (Misha) |archiveurl= https://www.webcitation.org/6sH2u3q4x?url=http://saon.ru/forum/viewtopic.php?p=118241#p118241 |archivedate= 27 July 2017 |accessdate= 27 July 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> [[File:Farikh-Ryabchinskii-sailplane-Shevlino.jpg|thumb|Mikhail Farikh after his first flight on a glider in 2012.]]
After major reforms to Russian aviation legislation in 2010, he mastered the new flight rules and helped other pilots to do so.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.ntv.ru/novosti/209407/ |title= Путь в небо открыт |publisher= НТВ |date= 1 November 2010 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420195605/http://www.ntv.ru/novosti/209407/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> In 2012, he was the first Russian private pilot to cross the border of Russia in a helicopter under the new rules for foreign flights.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://inosmi.ru/social/20100504/159714380.html |title= Московская элита осваивает небо над столицей |publisher= Financial Times / Иносми.ru |author= Уивер Кортни |date= 4 May 2010 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420195804/http://inosmi.ru/social/20100504/159714380.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.myhelicopter.ru/news/2012/12/17/ |title= Траектория движения вверх |publisher= MyHelicopter.ru |author= Пресс служба Авиамаркет |date= 17 December 2012 |location= Moscow |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205745/http://www.myhelicopter.ru/news/2012/12/17/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
He twice (in 2010 and 2013) organized the Robinson Safety Course (a safe piloting course) in Moscow, as well as a workshop led by the British pilot Quentin Smith ({{lang-en|Quentin Smith}}, nicknamed “Captain Q”<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.vertolet.ru/press-room/events/quentin-smith-the-master-class-of-the-famous-pilot-in-the-company-alimarket/ |title= Квентин Смит: мастер-класс знаменитого пилота в компании «Авиамаркет» |publisher= Heliport Istra |date= 18 November 2010 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420195832/http://www.vertolet.ru/press-room/events/quentin-smith-the-master-class-of-the-famous-pilot-in-the-company-alimarket/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> on operating the Robinson R44 in the cold months of the year and under ever-changing weather conditions. Quentin is considered to be one of the most experienced Robinson R44 pilots; he twice went around the world by helicopter and became the first pilot in aviation history who landed a piston helicopter on both the North and South Poles.<ref>{{cite web|title=Robinson R44 Astro G-MURY|url=https://airandspace.si.edu/collection-objects/robinson-r44-astro-g-mury|publisher=Smithsonian air and space museum|accessdate=2017-07-28|language=English|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sIUY604m?url=https://airandspace.si.edu/collection-objects/robinson-r44-astro-g-mury|archivedate=28 July 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=AVAUNT ISSUE FOUR LAUNCHES AT BREITLING|url=https://www.avauntmagazine.com/adventure/avaunt-launch-breitling-quentin-smith|date=5 September 2016|publisher=Avaunt Magazine|accessdate=2017-07-28|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sIWjZSAH?url=https://www.avauntmagazine.com/adventure/avaunt-launch-breitling-quentin-smith|archivedate=28 July 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=SADIE WHITELOCKS|title='I started flying helicopters when I was five': Meet the aviation maestro who has circumnavigated the world TWICE and almost died after crash landing in the Antarctic|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/travel_news/article-3976208/I-started-flying-helicopters-five-Meet-aviation-maestro-circumnavigated-world-TWICE-died-crash-landing-Antarctic.html|accessdate=2017-07-28|language=English|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sIUiWELO?url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/travel_news/article-3976208/I-started-flying-helicopters-five-Meet-aviation-maestro-circumnavigated-world-TWICE-died-crash-landing-Antarctic.html|archivedate=28 July 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref>
Between September 22 and 26, Mikhail Farikh and Dmitry Rakitsky carried out a speed-record-breaking flight from Moscow to Sakhalin. The [[Fédération Aéronautique Internationale|FAI]] registered three records at once as a result of this four-day flight.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://helisport.org/2016/04/в-это-воскресенье-мы-прощаемся-с-нашим/ |title= В это воскресенье мы прощаемся с нашим другом - пилотом Михаилом Фарихом |date= 22 April 2016 |publisher= ФВС России |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170426132146/http://helisport.org/2016/04/%D0%B2-%D1%8D%D1%82%D0%BE-%D0%B2%D0%BE%D1%81%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%8C%D0%B5-%D0%BC%D1%8B-%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%BE%D1%89%D0%B0%D0%B5%D0%BC%D1%81%D1%8F-%D1%81-%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%88%D0%B8%D0%BC/ |archivedate= 26 April 2017 |accessdate= 26 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
=== Volunteer Air Rescuer ===
[[File:Cook. Pilot R44 Michael Farikh (9349780779).jpg|thumb|Mikhail Farikh cooking meat at an airshow ]] Mikhail was one of the first pilots in Russia who helped rescue people who had gotten lost in the woods.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.matrony.ru/iz-biznesa-v-spasateli/ |title= Небо. Вертолёт. Девушка |author= Кнорре Ксения Дмитриева |publisher= Матроны.ру |date= 27 January 2017 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205608/http://www.matrony.ru/iz-biznesa-v-spasateli/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= https://snob.ru/profile/24088/blog/119720 |title= Александр и Елена Жуперины: «Как стать вертолётными чемпионами» |publisher= Сноб |date= 24 January 2017 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420200001/https://snob.ru/profile/24088/blog/119720 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://varlamov.ru/1648804.html |title= Волонтер "Лиза Алерт" погиб при крушении вертолета на Ямале |author= |publisher= Блог Ильи Варламова |date= 19 April 2016 |archiveurl= https://perma.cc/2MRL-FFCD |archivedate= 27 July 2017 |accessdate= 27 July 2017 |deadurl= no |df= }}{{cbignore}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=ДИНА КАРПИЦКАЯ|title=Поисково-спасательный отряд «Ангел»: как добровольцы на собственных вертолетах ищут пропавших людей|url=https://www.kp.ru/daily/26730/3757165/|date=2017-09-12|publisher=Комсомольская правда|accessdate=2017-09-13|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6tRsWN86s?url=https://www.kp.ru/daily/26730/3757165/|archivedate=13 September 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> In 2011, he took part in four search-and-rescue operations in cooperation with the Liza Alert volunteer organization. He flew for a total of about 15 hours<ref name="nomination2013"/> This initiative led to the formation of the Angel helicopter search-and-rescue detachment,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://newokruga.ru/dobryie-angelyi-letyat-k-vam-na-pomoshh/ |title= Добрые ангелы летят к вам на помощь |publisher= Новые округа |author= Гаврилова Светлана |date= 25 November 2016 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205533/http://newokruga.ru/dobryie-angelyi-letyat-k-vam-na-pomoshh/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> which now comprises over 90 people. Mikhail continued to take part in rescues and joint exercises.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://360tv.ru/news/uchenija-spasatelnogo-otrjada-liza-alert-proshli-v-kaluzhskoj-oblasti-39731/ |title= Учения спасательного отряда «Лиза Алерт» прошли в Калужской области |publisher= 360.tv |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420211142/http://360tv.ru/news/uchenija-spasatelnogo-otrjada-liza-alert-proshli-v-kaluzhskoj-oblasti-39731/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> He was posthumously awarded the badge of honor of the Angel helicopter search-and-rescue detachment.<ref>{{cite web|author=КСЕНИЯ КНОРРЕ-ДМИТРИЕВА|title=Вертолетный отряд «Ангел»: Сказать «нет» никто из нас уже не может|url=http://www.pravmir.ru/creative/vertoletnyiy-otryad-angel-skazat-net-nikto-iz-nas-uzhe-ne-mozhet/|publisher=Православный мир|accessdate=2017-08-04|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sSZtCStl?url=http://www.pravmir.ru/creative/vertoletnyiy-otryad-angel-skazat-net-nikto-iz-nas-uzhe-ne-mozhet/|archivedate=2017-08-04|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> In addition to searching for people (mushroom gatherers, tourists, etc.), he participated in search-and-rescue operations aimed at searching for crews of aircraft in distress. He vigorously advocated the mandatory use of satellite trackers ([[SPOT (satellite)|SPOT]], [[inReach]], etc.), which make it possible to find aircraft following accidents.
=== Flight to the North Pole === In 2013, he reached the North Pole as a crew member with PIC [[Dmitrii Rakitsky]], flying the Moscow — North Pole — Moscow route. The crew was the first in the world to make that flight with the light helicopter Robinson R66.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.verticalmag.com/press-releases/to-the-north-pole-in-a-robinson-r66/ |title= To the North Pole in a Robinson R66 |publisher= Vertical magazine |author= |date= 17 May 2013 |archiveurl= https://archive.li/20170517211204/https://www.verticalmag.com/press-releases/to-the-north-pole-in-a-robinson-r66/ |archivedate= 17 May 2017 |accessdate= 18 May 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Елена Солдатова|title=Пилоты уходят в небо|url=http://in-istra.ru/novosti/proisshestviya/piloty-uhodyat-v-nebo|date=14 February 2017|accessdate=4 August 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sSZZEpju?url=http://in-istra.ru/novosti/proisshestviya/piloty-uhodyat-v-nebo|archivedate=4 August 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|title=R66 Flies to North Pole|journal=Robinson News|volume=Volume 19|issue=2|url=https://robinsonheli.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/2013_summer.pdf}}</ref> Flights past the Arctic Circle were also performed for scientific purposes. During the flight, with the participation of the polar explorer [[Oleg Prodan|Oleg Prodan]], they placed radio buoys at the location where the schooner Svyataya Anna from the [[Brusilov Expedition|Brusilov Expedition]] was wrecked, so as to determine the direction of ice drift,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.mk.ru/science/2013/04/26/848104-v-arktike-pyitayutsya-razgadat-taynu-geroya-znamenitoy-povesti-dva-kapitana.html |title= В Арктике пытаются разгадать тайну героя знаменитой повести «Два капитана» |publisher= [[Московский комсомолец]] |author= Добровольский Александр |date= 26 April 2013 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420200140/http://www.mk.ru/science/2013/04/26/848104-v-arktike-pyitayutsya-razgadat-taynu-geroya-znamenitoy-povesti-dva-kapitana.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> which might make it possible to discover the ship itself.
=== Around-the-World Flight === The first attempt to fly around the world in 2012 did not move beyond the preparatory stage, as the US aviation authorities issued a [[NOTAM]], according to which aircraft of several countries, including those registered in Russia, were not cleared for flights under the VFR over American territory.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://snob.ru/profile/24088/print/89258 |title= Бизнесмен, частный пилот Михаил Фарих: «Как облететь на вертолёте вокруг Земли» |publisher= Сноб |date= 11 March 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205401/https://snob.ru/profile/24088/print/89258 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.mk.ru/mosobl/2013/08/13/898620-vint-vokrug-sveta.html |title= Винт вокруг света |publisher= Московский комсомолец |author= Алексеев Дмитрий |date= 13 August 2013 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205331/http://www.mk.ru/mosobl/2013/08/13/898620-vint-vokrug-sveta.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
In 2013 the around-the-world flight attempt met with success.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.forbes.ru/forbeslife/dosug/250012-vokrug-sveta-za-220-chasov-zachem-chetvero-biznesmenov-obleteli-na-vertolete |title= Вокруг света за 220 часов: зачем четверо бизнесменов облетели на вертолёте земной шар |publisher= [[Forbes]] |author= Чайкина Юлия |date= 24 January 2014 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205212/http://www.forbes.ru/forbeslife/dosug/250012-vokrug-sveta-za-220-chasov-zachem-chetvero-biznesmenov-obleteli-na-vertolete |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Dale|first1=Smith|title=Around the World in a Pair of Robinson R66s|url=https://www.ainonline.com/aviation-news/business-aviation/2013-10-21/around-world-pair-robinson-r66s|website=Aviation International News|accessdate=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6u5a9AvFw?url=https://www.ainonline.com/aviation-news/business-aviation/2013-10-21/around-world-pair-robinson-r66s|archivedate=9 October 2017|language=en|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> It was carried out by two Robinson R66s, flown by Farikh and [[Dmitrii Rakitsky|Dmitrii Rakitsky]], [[Alexander Kurylev|Alexander Kurylev]], and Vadim Melnikov. Cameraman and film director Dmitrii Kubasov traveled the whole way with the pilots. This was the first around-the-world helicopter flight in Russian history.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://brl.mk.ru/article/2013/09/18/916929-nebo-pilotyi-i-dva-vertoleta.html |title= Небо, пилоты и два вертолёта |publisher= [[Московский комсомолец]] |author= Рассказова Виктория |date= 18 September 2013 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205138/http://brl.mk.ru/article/2013/09/18/916929-nebo-pilotyi-i-dva-vertoleta.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
=== Other Aviation Activity === As an active member of the Russian aviation community and representative of AOPA Russia, Mikhail developed relationships with government agencies and regulatory bodies and participated in various events along with other GA pilots.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GgfEzDOQXEc Совещание Ространснадзора в УТЦ-22. Выступление М.Фариха от лица АОПА-Россия] Youtube (10.04.2012).</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Michael Farikh - The Godfather of Russian Helicopter Aviation {{!}} Heliweb Magazine|url=http://www.heliweb.com/michael-farikh-godfather-russian-helicopter/|website=Heliweb Magazine|accessdate=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6u5ZSbZtk?url=http://www.heliweb.com/michael-farikh-godfather-russian-helicopter/|archivedate=9 October 2017|date=6 June 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> He also took part in various air shows and events — Vertoslet,<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.vertmir.ru/main/reports?id=434 |title= «Вертослет» – главный воздушный праздник 2014 года |publisher= Вертикальный Мир |date= 2014-06-05 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210221/http://www.vertmir.ru/main/reports?id=434 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://bg.ru/blogs/posts/13561/ |title= Мне бы в небо |publisher= Bg.ru |author= Иваницкая Алиса |date= 16 June 2014 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210107/http://bg.ru/blogs/posts/13561/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> the travel-media PereDvizheniye Festival,<ref name=vestirutravel>{{cite web |url= http://travel.vesti.ru/article_13690 |title= Гость фестиваля - легендарный авиатор, частный пилот-спортсмен Михаил Фарих |publisher= Вести.ру |author= Шевелев Герман |date= 5 August 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420205929/http://travel.vesti.ru/article_13690 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> and others.
In 2015, under Mikhail’s leadership, a group of five helicopters<ref>{{cite web |url= https://dni.ru/society/2015/4/6/299952.html |title= Пилотов из Шереметьево отправили в Арктику |publisher= Дни.Ру |date= 6 April 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210411/https://dni.ru/society/2015/4/6/299952.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> (the crew of one of them containing representatives from the USA, Britain, and Russia) visited three poles — the magnetic pole, the geographic pole, and the [[pole of inaccessibility]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.heliport-moscow.ru/media/news/rossiyskie-vertoletchiki-pokorili-severnyy-polyus-ustanoviv-mirovoy-rekord/ |title= Российские вертолётчики покорили Северный полюс, установив мировой рекорд! |publisher= «Хелипорт Москва» |date= 15 April 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210954/http://www.heliport-moscow.ru/media/news/rossiyskie-vertoletchiki-pokorili-severnyy-polyus-ustanoviv-mirovoy-rekord/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Григорий Ландышев|title=Пора пересесть на вертолет|url=http://www.gq.ru/lifestyle/pora-peresest-na-vertolet|date=11 June 2015|publisher=GQ|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sQLf7dgx?url=http://www.gq.ru/lifestyle/pora-peresest-na-vertolet|archivedate=2 August 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref> During this flight, a unique refueling feat was accomplished with the use of a store of fuel arranged ahead of time on drift ice.
In 2015, at the annual conference of AOPA Russia, he presented the Pilot of the Year award in his capacity as the King of Arms of the organization.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.aopa.ru/index.php?id=108 |title= Номинанты премии «Наши Крылья» 2015 |publisher= АОПА-Россия |date= 2 November 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210454/http://www.aopa.ru/index.php?id=108 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
Also in 2015, Mikhail took part in a successful attempt to set the [[Guinness World Record|Guinness World Record]] for the largest helicopter formation.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.aex.ru/m/news/2015/6/8/135633/ |title= 6 июня установлен Мировой рекорд российских вертолётчиков |publisher= AEX |date= 8 June 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420213043/https://www.aex.ru/m/news/2015/6/8/135633/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Spotlight: Russian pilots take to the skies for spectacular largest helicopter formation flight|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2015/8/spotlight-russian-pilots-take-to-the-skies-for-spectacular-largest-helicopter-fo-390505|website=Guinness World Records|accessdate=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6u5vSgQej?url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2015/8/spotlight-russian-pilots-take-to-the-skies-for-spectacular-largest-helicopter-fo-390505|archivedate=9 October 2017|date=5 August 2015|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref>
When Mikhail himself did not take part in the flights, he did a lot to make them possible, by sharing experience with others, rendering organizational assistance, and following his colleagues’ flights closely.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://mir24.tv/news/society/11893574 |title= Менеджер из Москвы бросил карьеру ради путешествия на вертолёте |publisher= Мир |date= 9 January 2015 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210916/http://mir24.tv/news/society/11893574 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://finparty.ru/uvlecheniya/18967/ |title= Рубен Аганбегян: «Как я облетел на вертолёте всю Европу» |work= Finparty |publisher= ООО «Информационное агентство Банки.ру» |author= Маслова Дарья |date= 13 December 2013 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170421072658/http://finparty.ru/uvlecheniya/18967/ |archivedate= 21 April 2017 |accessdate= 21 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> One of the biggest projects undertaken with Mikhail’s assistance was the 2014 Moscow — New Zealand — Moscow flight headed by [[Evgeny Kabanov]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://russia.tv/video/show/brand_id/5403/episode_id/1083017/video_id/1073083 |title= Вести-Москва. Эфир от 16.09.2014 (11:30) |publisher= Сетевое издание «Государственный Интернет-Канал «Россия» |date= 16 September 2014 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170421072852/http://russia.tv/video/show/brand_id/5403/episode_id/1083017/video_id/1073083 |archivedate= 21 April 2017 |accessdate= 21 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wxKu78CqJbQ Выпуск 194] Пилот ТВ (18.09.2014).</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.aviaport.ru/digest/2014/04/07/282393.html |title= 12 апреля - Суперкубок "HeliFamily 2014" |publisher= АвиаПОРТ |date= 7 April 2014 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420210709/https://www.aviaport.ru/digest/2014/04/07/282393.html |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> Mikhail also played a big role in the 2015 attempt by [[Sergey Ananov]] to carry out a solo around-the-world flight in a Robinson R22.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://flarf.ru/news/109/68/vertoslet-proekt-treh-federatsij/ |title= «Вертослет» – проект трёх федераций |publisher= Федерация любителей авиации России |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170421072927/http://flarf.ru/news/109/68/vertoslet-proekt-treh-federatsij/ |archivedate= 21 April 2017 |accessdate= 21 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.popularmechanics.com/adventure/outdoors/a19225/marooned-among-the-polar-bears/ |title= Marooned Among the Polar Bears |publisher= Popular Mechanics |author= Nobel Justin |date= 17 February 2016 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20160317014120/http://www.popularmechanics.com/adventure/outdoors/a19225/marooned-among-the-polar-bears/ |archivedate= 17 March 2016 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Russian pilot who crashed in Arctic survives encounter with polar bears|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/arctic/11766875/Russian-pilot-who-crashed-in-Arctic-survives-encounter-with-polar-bears.html|website=The Telegraph|accessdate=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6u5ZiOphC?url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/arctic/11766875/Russian-pilot-who-crashed-in-Arctic-survives-encounter-with-polar-bears.html|archivedate=9 October 2017|date=28 July 2015|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref>
=== Death during the “Searching for the Two Captains” expedition === [[File:Михаил Фарих Экспедиция По следам двух капитанов.webm|thumb|Mikhail Farikh talks about the goal of the last expedition. Recorded on the day of the catastrophe — June 18, 2016.]]
Mikhail Farikh died on April 18, 2016<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fg6sP4nayEU Свидетельства очевидцев: крушение вертолёта Robinson R-66 RA-06233 на острове Белый] Время Ямала (19 April 2016).</ref> during the second helicopter expedition in search of the [[Svyataya Anna|Svyataya Anna]] gunvessel. The fatal crash occurred at 22:06 local time (17:06 UTC) at {{coord|73|19|40|N|69|59|37|E|name=crash site}} [[Oleg Prodan|Oleg Prodan]], polar explorer and director of the Onezhskoye Pomorye National Park, and Alexei Frolov, founder and owner of the Mirital company, died along with him.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://ren.tv/novosti/2016-04-19/znamenityy-pilot-puteshestvennik-pogib-pri-krushenii-vertoleta-v-arktike |title= Знаменитый пилот-путешественник погиб при крушении вертолёта в Арктике |publisher= РЕН ТВ |date= 19 April 2016 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420211536/http://ren.tv/novosti/2016-04-19/znamenityy-pilot-puteshestvennik-pogib-pri-krushenii-vertoleta-v-arktike |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://tass.ru/proisshestviya/3217382 |title= Лёгкий вертолёт потерпел крушение в районе острова Белый в Арктике, три человека погибли |publisher= ТАСС |author= Лысцева Марина |date= 19 April 2016 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420211240/http://tass.ru/proisshestviya/3217382 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.vdvsn.ru/novosti/obshchestvo/pamyati_pogibshikh_v_aviakatastrofe_na_ostrove_belyy/ |title= Памяти погибших в авиакатастрофе на острове Белый |publisher= Северная Неделя |date= 22 April 2016 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420211424/http://www.vdvsn.ru/novosti/obshchestvo/pamyati_pogibshikh_v_aviakatastrofe_na_ostrove_belyy/ |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> All three men held private pilot licenses with the helicopter pilot entry.<ref name=prodanbio>{{cite web|url=http://ru.arctic.ru/authors/prodan/|title=Наши эксперты:Олег Леонидович Продан|publisher=Сайт Международного арктического форума|date=|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6sH2Htgrg?url=http://ru.arctic.ru/authors/prodan/|archivedate=27 July 2017|accessdate=27 July 2017|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Michael Farikh Killed in Crash of R66 in Russia|url=http://www.heliweb.com/adventurer-round-world-pilot-michael-farikh-killed-crash-russia/|website=Heliweb Magazine|accessdate=9 October 2017|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6u5ZK4jbi?url=http://www.heliweb.com/adventurer-round-world-pilot-michael-farikh-killed-crash-russia/|archivedate=9 October 2017|date=19 April 2016|deadurl=yes|df=}}</ref>
A group of three [[Robinson R66]] helicopters participating in the “Searching for the Two Captains” expedition was flying along the route from [[Amderma Airport]] to the landing site on [[Bely Island]] in the Kara Sea. While they were approaching the island, thick, low cloud cover formed. The crew of the formation leader decided to descend into the clouds to determine their lower boundary and see if it was possible to land. While carrying out this mission, the helicopter crashed to the ground.<ref name=report/>
The IAC board’s report it states that “the most probable cause of the R66 RA-06233 helicopter’s crash was the PIC’s loss of flight altitude control during the attempt to establish visual contact with terrain under weather conditions that did not comply with VFR and the pilot’s experience level, which led to the aircraft’s collision with the icy surface of the Kara Sea”.<ref name=report>{{cite web|url= http://mak-iac.org/upload/iblock/fa1/report_ra-06233.pdf |title= ОКОНЧАТЕЛЬНЫЙ ОТЧЁТ ПО РЕЗУЛЬТАТАМ РАССЛЕДОВАНИЯ АВИАЦИОННОГО ПРОИСШЕСТВИЯ |publisher= МЕЖГОСУДАРСТВЕННЫЙ АВИАЦИОННЫЙ КОМИТЕТ |date= 18 April 2016 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170420213245/http://mak-iac.org/upload/iblock/fa1/report_ra-06233.pdf |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate=20 April 2017}}</ref>
A large crowd paid its last respects to the deceased crew in the memorial hall of the Troyekurovskoye Cemetery on April 24, 2016. Mikhail Farikh is buried at the [[Novodevichy Cemetery]] in Moscow, Alexei Frolov is buried at the Zvyaginskoe cemetery (Moscow region), while Oleg Prodan was buried in at his birthplace in Rybinsk, along with his parents.<ref name=prodancompetition>{{cite web |url= http://rusnord.ru/dayly/35952-nebo-olega-prodana.html |title= Небо Олега Продана |publisher= Информационно-аналитический портал RUSNORD |date= 24 May 2017 |archiveurl= https://www.webcitation.org/6sH236Qyv?url=http://rusnord.ru/dayly/35952-nebo-olega-prodana.html |archivedate= 27 July 2017 |accessdate= 27 July 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
== Memorialization == In recognition of Mikhail’s contributions to the development of sound-system competitions, the National Association of Automobile Audio Competitions, АМТ Eurasia, declared the 2016 season the Season in Memory of Mikhail Farikh.<ref name= amtrussia />
In spring 2017, work to memorialize convoy BD-5<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.yamal.aif.ru/society/na_ostrov_belyy_vezut_memorial_pamyati_konvoya_bd-5_i_elektrogenerator |title= На остров Белый везут мемориал памяти конвоя БД-5 и электрогенератор |publisher= Аргументы и факты |author= Мартьянова Юлия |location= Ямал |date= 5 March 2017 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420213417/http://www.yamal.aif.ru/society/na_ostrov_belyy_vezut_memorial_pamyati_konvoya_bd-5_i_elektrogenerator |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> and the crew of the lost R66 on Belyi Island was undertaken. On March 17, 2017, a large wooden cross was installed on the island at {{coord|73.332373|70.067851|name=memorial}} with the support of the non-profit partnership Arctic Development Center.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://arctic-rf.ru/news/ostrov-belyy/ustanovka-pamyatnogo-kresta-na-meste-krusheniya-vertoleta-robinson-66-ra-06233 |title= Установка памятного креста на месте крушения вертолёта Robinson 66 RА-06233 |publisher= Российский центр освоения арктики |date= 17 March 2017 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420213537/http://arctic-rf.ru/news/ostrov-belyy/ustanovka-pamyatnogo-kresta-na-meste-krusheniya-vertoleta-robinson-66-ra-06233 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> A month later, on April 13, 2017, an AOPA Russia air expedition attached a plaque with the following explanatory text to the cross:
{{Quote box|width=100% |quote = ''Mikhail Farikh, Oleg Prodan, Alexei Frolov. They were searching for the Svyataya Anna schooner, which vanished in the Arctic ice in 1912–14 during Georgy Brusilov’s expedition. Their helicopter crashed into the Arctic near Belyi Island on April 18, 2016 during the fifth search of the “Searching for the Two Captains” expedition. They passed away, but their cause remains alive. To strive, to seek, to find, and not to yield!''<ref>{{cite web |url= http://aopa.ru/index.php?id=129 |title= По следам двух капитанов |publisher= АОПА-Россия |date= 19 April 2017 |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170420213654/http://aopa.ru/index.php?id=129 |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate= 20 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>}}
[[File:Il14-penguin-night.jpg|thumb| An [[Il-14 Pingvin|Il-14 "Penguin"]] named after Mikhail Farikh]]
In 2016, an Il-14 Penguin restored to airworthy condition by enthusiasts was named after Mikhail Farikh.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://flighttv.ru/movie/Flight-TV-Vypusk-39.html |title= Flight TV - выпуск 39 |publisher= Flight TV |author= |location= Ямал |date= 5 June 2016 |archiveurl= https://www.webcitation.org/6sCYzxiiq?url=http://flighttv.ru/movie/Flight-TV-Vypusk-39.html |archivedate= 24 July 2017 |accessdate= 24 July 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref>
== World Records == Mikhail set three speed records along these routes in the class of piston helicopters with [[MTOW]] of 1,000 to 1,750 kg:
#Istra, Moscow Region (Bunkovo) — Tyumen: 173.04 km/h<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.fai.org/fai-record-file/?recordId=16639 |title= Описание рекорда #16639 |publisher= FAI |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170421073033/http://www.fai.org/fai-record-file/?recordId=16639 |archivedate= 21 April 2017 |accessdate= 21 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> — currently valid world record.
#Istra, Moscow Region (Bunkovo — Krasnoyarsk: 99.34 km/h<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.fai.org/fai-record-file/?recordId=16640 |title= Описание рекорда #16640 |publisher= FAI |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170421073145/http://www.fai.org/fai-record-file/?recordId=16640 |archivedate= 21 April 2017 |accessdate= 21 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> — currently valid world record.
#Istra, Moscow Region (Bunkovo — Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk: 66.15 km/h<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.fai.org/fai-record-file/?recordId=16636 |title= Описание рекорда #16636 |publisher= FAI |archiveurl= https://archive.is/20170421073212/http://www.fai.org/fai-record-file/?recordId=16636 |archivedate= 21 April 2017 |accessdate= 21 April 2017 |deadurl= yes |df= }}</ref> — currently valid world record.
== Awards == FAI Air Sport Medal.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.fai.org/awards/fai-general-awards |title= AWARD ID 6296 |publisher= FAI |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20170420212845/http://www.fai.org/awards/fai-general-awards |archivedate= 20 April 2017 |accessdate=20 April 2017}}</ref> This medal is awarded to individuals or groups for “prominent services to the cause of air sports; for instance, work on FAI committees, the organization of world or continental championships, training of new pilots, or development of aviation as a whole, particularly if this is aimed at the involvement of young people in air sports.
The text of the FAI nomination: {{Quote | quote = ''An experienced pilot and adventurer, a participant in search and rescue air operations. An aerial sports competitor. A member of numerous helicopter flights in Russia and around the world, including a trip to the North Pole as a member of a scientific expedition in April 2013, and a transatlantic flight in 2009. In 2012, he established three world speed records on the Robinson R44 helicopter en route from Moscow to Sakhalin. A member of the first world helicopter flight in the history of Russian aviation, in August–September 2013. For active work to improve safety and air legislation development, for active participation in training of flight personnel. For active promotion of aviation sports in Russia.'' | author = | title = | source = | character = | multiline = | style = }} * «Helicopter Industry Association» award winner (2003 y). Nomination "Sportsmen of the year".<ref name="nomination2013"/>

page.title: NOAAS Okeanos Explorer Gulf of Mexico 2017 Expedition

revision.comment: Adding [[Wikipedia:Short description|short description]]: "The first of three expeditions on the NOAAS Okeanos Explorer intended to increase the understanding of the deep-sea environment in the Gulf of Mexico" ([[User:Galobtter/Shortdesc helper|Shortdesc helper]])
revision.text:
{{short description|The first of three expeditions on the NOAAS Okeanos Explorer intended to increase the understanding of the deep-sea environment in the Gulf of Mexico}} {{Infobox spaceflight | name = Gulf of Mexico 2017 | image = GolfOfMexico2017Expedition.png | image_caption = Map of the general expedition operating area.
| mission_type = Telepresence-enabled expedition | mission_duration = 23 days <ref name=GOM2017>{{cite web|title = Gulf of Mexico 2017 |url=https://oceanexplorer.noaa.gov/okeanos/explorations/ex1711/logs/summary/welcome.html|publisher=NOAA|accessdate=28 June 2018}}</ref>
| start_date = {{start-date|29 November 2017}}<ref name=GOM2017/> | end_date = {{end-date|21 December 2017}}<ref name=GOM2017/> | vessel = [[NOAAS Okeanos Explorer]] }}
'''NOASS Okeanos Explorer Gulf of Mexico 2017 Expedition '''was the first of three expeditions on the [[NOAAS Okeanos Explorer]] intended to increase the understanding of the deep-sea environment in the [[Gulf of Mexico]]. Gulf of Mexico 2017 was a 23-day [[telepresence]]-enabled expedition focused on acquiring data on priority exploration areas identified by ocean management and scientific communities. The goal of the expedition was to use remotely operated vehicle (ROV) dives and seafloor mapping operations to increase the understanding of the deep-sea ecosystems in these areas to support management decisions. Many of the areas had no (or low quality) [[sonar]] data, these areas were top priority for high-resolution [[bathymetry]] collection. The expedition established a baseline of information in the region to catalyze further exploration, research, and management activities.<ref name=GOM2017/><ref>{{cite web|title = Scientists Explore Deep, Dark Secrets of the Gulf of Mexico |url=http://www.pewtrusts.org/en/research-and-analysis/articles/2018/05/14/scientists-explore-deep-dark-secrets-of-the-gulf-of-mexico|publisher=PEW|accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref>
Through discussions and information stemming from [[National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration|NOAA]] and other stakeholders, priority areas of exploration had been identified. The expedition explored deep [[Deep-water coral|coral]] and [[sponge]] communities, bottom fish habitats, [[seamount|seamounts]], [[submarine canyon|undersea canyons]], [[shipwreck]]s, and a variety of [[Chemosynthesis|chemosynthetic]] habitats including [[Cold seep|cold seeps]], [[mud volcano|mud volcanoes]] and [[brine pool|brine pools]]. Using NOAA Ship Okeanos Explorer’s unique capabilities, scientists and other audiences onshore were provided with real-time video footage from deep-water areas in important, yet largely unknown, U.S. waters.<ref name=GOM2017/>
==ROV Dives== [[Image:GOM2017leptoFish.jpg|left|thumb|Fish experts on the global midwater team were blown away by the appearance of this fish from the genus ''[[Leptochilichthys]]''. The observation placed this fish at a shallow depth of 900 meters, when typical observations place this fish squarely in the [[Bathyal zone|bathypelagic zone]] at ~2,000 meters.<ref name=BIGOM2017>{{cite web|title = Scientists spent a month exploring the Gulf of Mexico's deep sea habitats — and the images they brought back are astonishing|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/deep-sea-creatures-from-the-gulf-of-mexico-2018-1|publisher=Business Insider|accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref>]] 17 ROV dives were conducted from 300 to 2,321 [[metre|meters]] of depth to explore the diversity and distribution of deep-sea habitats and associated marine communities in the Gulf of Mexico basin. There were also four midwater exploration dives conducted at depths of 300 to 900 meters to investigate the diversity and abundance of the largely unknown [[Pelagic zone|pelagic]] [[fauna]]. During these dives hundreds of different species of animals were observed including several potential new species. Several significant [[Geographic range limit|range extensions]] were observed and several organisms were seen alive for the first time. 105 biological samples (32 primary and 73 associated and commensal taxa) were collected several of which came from unknown species. As well as biological samples eight rock samples and one sediment sample were collected for use in [[Geochemistry|geochemical]] composition analysis and age dating. Several dives gathered geological data to better understand the geological composition and origin of the [[Florida Platform|Florida Escarpment]].<ref name=GOM2017/>
At least 20 previously unknown [[Chemosynthesis|chemosynthetic]] habitats were discovered including [[Cold seep|methane seeps]] (some with visible [[Clathrate hydrate|methane hydrate]]), [[Petroleum seep|asphalt seeps]], and [[Brine pool|brine rivers]].Most of these had associated chemosynthetic communities that included large [[Siboglinidae|siboglinid tubeworm]] bushes and extensive [[mussel]] beds. There were also many areas of reduced sediments and [[Microbial mat|bacterial mats]]. Asphaltic and [[Authigenesis|authigenic carbonate]] outcrops hosting large [[Filter feeder|filter-feeding]] communities were also observed in geologically active areas.<ref name=GOM2017/>
A number of the ROV dives surveyed Habitat Areas of Particular Concern (HAPCs) proposed by the [[U.S. Regional Fishery Management Councils|Gulf of Mexico Fishery Management Council]]. These surveys collected baseline information for management of the area. Six proposed expansions zones to the [[Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary|Flower Garden Banks National Marine Sanctuary]] were explored and surveyed to gather information on future expansion of the sanctuary. Many high-diversity and density coral and sponge communities were discovered in these areas including a ''[[Madrepora oculata]]''-dominated coral garden.<ref name=GOM2017/>
[[Image:GOM2017Wreck15377.jpg|thumb|During Dive 7, ''[[Deep Discoverer]]'' explored an unknown shipwreck identified by the [[Bureau of Ocean Energy Management]] simply as “ID Number 15377.” .]] The wreck of an early 19th-century [[Copper sheathing|copper-clad merchant vessel]] carrying artifacts including glass bottles, ceramic and porcelain vessels, remnants of a [[Bilge pump|suction bilge pump]] with [[cast iron|cast-iron]] [[flywheel|flywheels]], an [[anchor]], and a cast-iron stove was surveyed and explored. Based on initial observations, archaeologists believe the shipwreck likely post-dates 1830 and may have been a merchant ship built for distance over speed.<ref name=GOM2017/><ref>{{cite web|title = Observations of Wreck "15377"|url=https://oceanexplorer.noaa.gov/okeanos/explorations/ex1711/logs/dec10/welcome.html|publisher=NOAA|accessdate=28 June 2018}}</ref><ref name=BIGOM2017/>
During one of the dives ''[[Enypniastes|Enypniastes eximia]]'' was spotted on the ocean floor.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bustle.com/p/this-noaa-headless-chicken-monster-video-is-the-trippiest-thing-youll-see-all-day-7737850|title=You Need To Watch This Video Of A "Headless Chicken Monster" In The Gulf Of Mexico|last=Millstein|first=Seth|work=Bustle|access-date=2018-06-29|language=en}}</ref>
===Gas Hydrate=== {{See also|Clathrate hydrate}} [[Image:Map_of_Horn_Dome.jpg|left|thumb|Dive 17 explored the northwest part of Horn Dome, a salt-cored bathymetric high that had been the focus of several previous remotely operated vehicle dives.]] [[Image:Methane_Hydrate_Stability.jpg|left|thumb|Methane hydrate is stable to the left of the purple curve on this temperature-depth plot. Each 100-meter increase in water depth corresponds to a pressure increase of ~10 [[Pascal (unit)|megapascals]]. ]]
During dive 17 the ROV ''[[Deep Discoverer]]'' encountered large [[gas]] hydrate mounds and active gas seeps on the sea floor on the northwestern edge of a salt-cored Horn Dome, 87 kilometers from the mouth of the [[Mississippi River]] in [[Louisiana]]. The low relief seafloor mounds discovered mantled gas hydrate deposits interspersed with [[carbonate|carbonates]]. Gas hydrate forms when low [[molecular mass|molecular weight]] gas (usually [[methane]]) combines with water and freezes to form "[[Methane clathrate|methane ice]]" under low temperature and moderate pressure conditions<ref name=Hydrates>{{cite web|title = What are gas hydrates? |url=https://www.usgs.gov/faqs/what-are-gas-hydrates?qt-news_science_products=0#qt-news_science_products|publisher=USGS|accessdate=29 June 2018}}</ref>. In the deepwater Gulf of Mexico, the ample supply of gas, coupled with appropriate pressure and temperature conditions, cause gas hydrate to form on or just beneath the seafloor. The blue curve on the graph shows the ocean temperatures measured by the conductivity-temperature-depth ([[CTD (instrument)|CTD]]) sensor on the Deep Discoverer ROV during Dive 17 at Horn Dome. The [[sediment]] temperatures are estimated based on a study that examined nearby well data. Gas hydrate is stable at the seafloor, in the shallow sediments, and from the seafloor to ~600 meters depth in the water column. Such conditions are typical for the deep ocean, but the Gulf of Mexico leaks such large volumes of gas that near-seafloor gas hydrate is more common there than in most locations.<ref name=Gas2017>{{cite web|title = Ice Worms and Gas Hydrate-Encased Bubble Tubes|url=https://oceanexplorer.noaa.gov/okeanos/explorations/ex1711/logs/dec20/welcome.html|publisher=NOAA|accessdate=28 June 2018}}</ref>
Scientists observed dense orange-stained gas hydrate exposed in several mounds. In some places, the same outcrop had both massive gas hydrate that had probably formed below the seafloor and clear, porous gas hydrate made up of hydrate-encased bubbles. Video recording of methane emissions adjacent to one of the massive hydrate deposits provided insights into seafloor gas dynamics. For example, rapid gas emissions produced bubbles, with some bubbles emerging from clear tubes formed from gas hydrate. Slow gas emissions led to the formation of hydrate-coated gas droplets that initially blocked the gas conduit until the pressure inside the droplet increased, causing the droplet to detach. Similar phenomena were filmed on bare seafloor in the Gulf of Mexico during a [[NOAAS Okeanos Explorer Gulf of Mexico 2014 Expedition|2014 Okeanos Explorer expedition]].<ref name=Gas2017/>
[[Image:IceWormsGOM2017.jpg|thumb|Pink “ice worms” are visible beneath the overhang in the center left part of this photo.]] The only macrofauna spotted living directly on methane hydrate outcrops were ice worms, ''[[Hesiocaeca methanicola]]''. The ice worms had burrowed into the hydrate, creating small depressions. The worms graze on bacteria growing on the hydrate.Ice worms were also seen in some of the burrows in the surrounding gas hydrate, which appears orange due to impurities. In the image to the right active methane emissions occur from beneath the ledge, through [[Pipe (fluid conveyance)|conduits]] at the base of the inverted droplets attached to the sediment and through a bubble tube at the right of the image. Both the bubble tubes and the inverted droplets are encased in clear gas hydrate.<ref name=Gas2017/>
==Outreach== The live video feeds of the expedition were shared publicly worldwide with the live video receiving more than 280,000 views via the [[Office of Ocean Exploration|NOAA Office of Ocean Exploration and Research (OER)]] YouTube channel. The expedition also conducted six live telepresence interactions with various groups including the [[Aquarium of the Pacific]], [[Shedd Aquarium]], NOAA Gulf Regional Council, [[Center for Coastal & Ocean Mapping|University of New Hampshire’s Center for Coastal and Ocean Mapping]], [[Exploratorium|The Exploratorium]], and members of the [[MIT Media Lab]].<ref name=GOM2017/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==See also== [[NOAAS Okeanos Explorer]]
[[NOAAS Okeanos Explorer Gulf of Mexico 2018 Expedition]]
[[Category:Oceanography]]

revision.text:
{{taxobox | image = Neolamarckia cadamba 6226.jpg | image_caption = Tree in [[Kolkata]], [[West Bengal]], [[India]]. | image2 = Neolamarckia_Cadamba_Flower.jpg | image2_caption = Close-up of flower | regnum = [[Plantae]] | unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] | unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] | unranked_ordo = [[Asterids]] | ordo = [[Gentianales]] | familia = [[Rubiaceae]] | subfamilia = [[Cinchonoideae]] | tribus = [[Naucleeae]] | genus = ''[[Neolamarckia]]'' | species = '''''N. cadamba''''' | binomial = ''Neolamarckia cadamba'' | binomial_authority = ([[Roxb.]]) [[Jean Marie Bosser|Bosser]] | synonyms_ref=<ref name="WCSP_133819">{{Cite web |title=''Neolamarckia cadamba''|website=World Checklist of Selected Plant Families |publisher=[[Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew]] |url=http://apps.kew.org/wcsp/namedetail.do?name_id=133819 |accessdate=2013-09-01}}</ref> | synonyms = * ''Nauclea cadamba'' <small>Roxb.</small> * ''Anthocephalus cadamba'' <small>(Roxb.) [[Miq.]]</small> * ''Anthocephalus indicus'' var. ''glabrescens'' <small>H.L.Li</small> * ''Anthocephalus morindifolius'' <small>[[Korth.]]</small> * ''Nauclea megaphylla'' <small>[[S.Moore]]</small> * ''Neonauclea megaphylla'' <small>(S.Moore) S.Moore</small> * ''Samama cadamba'' <small>(Roxb.) [[Kuntze]]</small> * ''Sarcocephalus cadamba'' <small>(Roxb.) Kurz</small> }}
'''''Neolamarckia cadamba''''', with English [[common name]]s '''burflower-tree''', '''laran''', and '''Leichhardt pine''',<ref name=GRIN>{{citation |url=https://npgsweb.ars-grin.gov/gringlobal/taxonomydetail.aspx?id=410705 |title=USDA GRIN Taxonomy}}</ref> and called '''kadam'''<ref name=GRIN/> locally, is an [[evergreen]], tropical tree native to [[South Asia|South]] and [[Southeast Asia]]. The genus name honours French naturalist [[Jean-Baptiste Lamarck]]. It has scented orange flowers in dense globe-shaped clusters. The flowers are used in perfumes. The tree is grown as an [[ornamental plant]] and for timber and paper-making. Kadam features in [[Indian religions]] and mythologies.
==Description== A fully mature kadam tree can reach up to {{convert|45|m|ft|abbr=on}} in height. It is a large tree with a broad crown and straight cylindrical bole. It is quick growing, with broad spreading branches and grows rapidly in the first 6–8 years. The trunk has a diameter of 100–160 cm, but typically less than that. Leaves are {{convert|13|-|32|cm|in|abbr=on}} long. Flowering usually begins when the tree is 4–5 years old. Kadam [[flower]]s are sweetly fragrant, red to orange in colour, occurring in dense, globular heads of approximately {{convert|5.5|cm|in|abbr=on}} diameter. The fruit of ''N. cadamba'' occur in small, fleshy capsules packed closely together to form a fleshy yellow-orange infructescence containing approximately 8000 seeds. On maturing, the fruit splits apart, releasing the seeds, which are then dispersed by wind or rain.<ref>http://www.agricultureinformation.com/forums/questions-answers/11926-anthocephalus-kadamba.html.- Horticulture/Suryanarmada, Agriculture Arbitration Consultant, Chennai, India.</ref><ref>[https://www.webcitation.org/query?url=http://www.geocities.com/vibhaskumar/plant_ism1.html&date=2009-10-25+23:56:54 - The Environmental Information System(ENVIS), Ministry of Environment and Forests - Centre of Mining environment]</ref>
* Stamens 5, inserted on the corolla tube, filaments short, anthers basifixed. Ovary inferior, [[locule|bi-locular]], sometimes 4-locular in the upper part, style exserted and a spindle-shaped stigma. * Fruitlets numerous with their upper parts containing 4 hollow or solid structures. Seed trigonal or irregularly shaped. * The [[sapwood (wood)|sapwood]] is white with a light yellow tinge becoming creamy yellow on exposure and is not clearly differentiated from the heartwood.
==Ecology== [[File:Leaves & flowers I IMG 8695.jpg|thumb|Leaves & flowers]] ''N. cadamba'' is native to the following areas: * Southern [[China]]<ref>Flora of China [http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon_id=220009137]</ref> * [[Indian subcontinent]]: [[India]] (n. & w.); [[Bangladesh]]; [[Nepal]]; [[Sri Lanka]] * [[Southeast Asia]]: [[Cambodia]]; [[Laos]]; [[Myanmar]]; [[Thailand]]; [[Vietnam]], [[Indonesia]]; [[Malaysia]]; [[Papua New Guinea]]; [[Australia]]
It is an introduced species in [[Puerto Rico]] at [[Toro Negro State Forest]].<ref name="drna.gobierno.pr">[http://www.drna.gobierno.pr/biblioteca/publicaciones/hojas-de-nuestro-ambiente/30-Toro%20Negro%20ultimo.pdf ''Bosques de Puerto Rico: Bosque Estatal de Toro Negro.''] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150807061645/http://www.drna.gobierno.pr/biblioteca/publicaciones/hojas-de-nuestro-ambiente/30-Toro%20Negro%20ultimo.pdf |date=2015-08-07 }} Hojas de Nuestro Ambiente. July 2008. [Publication/Issue: P-030] Puerto Rico Department of Natural and Environmental Resources. Retrieved 13 September 2013.</ref>
The [[larvae]] of the commander (''[[Moduza procris]]''), a [[Nymphalidae|brush-footed butterfly]], consume this species. The flowers attract pollinators.
==Taxonomy==
The [[botanical name]] of this species has been the subject of a long [[Taxonomy (biology)|taxonomic]] debate, beginning in the 1930s. The problem arose because scientific names are based on [[Type (biology)|type specimens]]. In 1785 [[Jean-Baptiste Lamarck]] described a specimen under the name ''Cephalanthus chinensis'', stating that it came from [[Madagascar]]. In 1830, [[Achille Richard]] created the name ''Anthocephalus indicus'', stating that the species came from Asia and that his description was based on the same specimen as Lamarck's ''Cephalanthus chinensis''.<ref name=Raza02/> (Under the rules of the [[International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants]], Richard should have used the name ''A. chinensis'' rather than ''A. indicus'', as he should not have changed the specific epithet.)
The issue is whether Richard was indeed using the same specimen as Lamarck; the geographical origin is said to be different, and the descriptions do not match; for example in Lamarck's ''Cephalanthus chinensis'' the [[inflorescence]]s are [[Axillary bud|axillary]] whereas in Richard's ''Anthocephalus'' they are terminal. If specimens were the same, then ''Anthocephalus'' is a synonym of the Madagascan ''Cephalanthus'' and cannot be a generic name for the Asian kadam tree. If they were different (in spite of Richard's claim that they were the same) then ''Anthocephalus'' could be a generic name for the kadam tree. Based on the latter view, the name ''Anthocephalus chinensis'' has been widely used for the kadam tree.<ref name=Raza02>{{Cite journal |last=Razafimandimbison |first=Sylvain G. |year=2002 |title=A Systematic Revision of ''Breonia'' (Rubiaceae-Naucleeae) |journal=Annals of the Missouri Botanical Garden |volume=89 |issue=1 |pages=1–37 |doi=10.2307/3298655 |ref=harv|jstor=3298655 }}</ref>
The current view taken by most taxonomic sources is that Richard's ''Anthocephalus indicus'' or ''Anthocephalus chinensis'' is a synonym of ''Cephalanthus chinensis'' (now transferred to the genus ''[[Breonia]]'' as ''[[Breonia chinensis]]'' <small>(Lam.) Capuron</small>), and that the widespread use of ''Anthocephalus chinensis'' for the kadam tree is an error. (This erroneous sense of the scientific name is shown by writing ''A. chinensis'' auct., where "auct." is an abbreviation of the Latin for "of authors", i.e. rather than of the correct authority.)<ref name=WCSP_133819/><ref name=GRIN/><ref name=Raza02/>
Given that Richard's name for the kadam tree is incorrect, the earliest name is [[William Roxburgh]]'s 1824 ''Nauclea cadamba''. In 1984, [[Jean Marie Bosser]] created the new generic name ''Neolamarckia'', honouring Lamarck, for the Asian genus which matched Richard's description of his ''Anthocephalus'', transferring ''Nauclea cadamba'' as ''Neolamarckia cadamba'' <small>(Roxb.) Bosser</small>.<ref name=Raza02/> However, not all botanical sources have accepted this taxonomic analysis and the name ''Anthocephalus'' is still in use for the Asian genus.<ref>{{cite book |last=Ridsdale |first=C. |year=1998 |chapter=Rubiaceae |pages=158–159 |editor-last=Dassanayke |editor-first=M.D. |title=A Revised Handbook to the Flora of Ceylon |publisher=A.A. Balkema |location=Rotterdam }} Cited in {{Harvtxt|Razafimandimbison|2002}}.</ref>
==Uses== The fruit and inflorescences are reportedly edible by humans. The fresh leaves are fed to cattle. ''N. lamarckia'' is grown as an [[Ornamental plant|ornamental]], and for low-grade timber and paper. The timber is used for plywood, light construction, pulp and paper, boxes and crates, dug-out canoes, and furniture components. Kadamba yields a pulp of satisfactory brightness and performance as a hand sheet. The wood can be easily impregnated with synthetic resins to increase its density and [[compressive strength]]. The wood has a density of 290–560 kg/cu m at 15% moisture content, a fine to medium texture; straight grain; low luster and has no characteristic odor or taste. It is easy to work, with hand and machine tools, cuts cleanly, gives a very good surface and is easy to nail. The timber air dries rapidly with little or no degrade. Kadamba wood is very easy to preserve using either open tank or pressure-vacuum systems.
Kadamba is one of the most frequently planted trees in the tropics. The tree is grown along avenues, roadsides and villages for shade. Kadamba are suitable for reforestation programs. It sheds large amounts of leaf and non-leaf litter which on decomposition improves some physical and [[Chemical property|chemical properties]] of soil under its canopy. This reflects an increase in the level of soil organic carbon, [[cation-exchange capacity]], available plant nutrients and exchangeable bases.
A yellow dye is obtained from the root bark. Kadamba flowers are an important raw material in the production of ‘attar’, which is Indian perfume with [[sandalwood]] (''Santalum'' spp.) base in which one of the essences is absorbed through hydro-distillation. An extract of the leaves serves as a mouth gargle.
The leaf extract has recently been used to produce [[silver nanoparticles]] for [[surface-enhanced Raman spectroscopy]].<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Ankamwar|first1=Balaprasad|last2=Sur|first2=Ujjal Kumar|last3=Das|first3=Pulak|title=SERS study of bacteria using biosynthesized silver nanoparticles as the SERS substrate|journal=Anal. Methods|date=2016|volume=8|issue=11|pages=2335–2340|doi=10.1039/C5AY03014E}}</ref>
== Cultural significance == [[File:Temple de Mînâkshî02.JPG|thumb|Kadamba tree at the entrance to the Meenakshi temple]]
===Symbolism=== The kadamba flower was the emblem of [[Athmallik State]], one of the [[princely state]]s of [[India]] during the period of the [[British Raj]].<ref name="BDG">L. E. B. Cobden-Ramsay, ''Feudatory States of Orissa: Bengal District Gazetteers'', p.115</ref>
The kadamba lends its name to the [[Kadamba Dynasty]] that ruled from Banavasi in what is now the state of [[Karnataka]] from 345 CE to 525 CE, as per Talagunda inscription of c.450 CE.<ref name="tree">George M. Moraes (1931), ''The Kadamba Kula, A History of Ancient and Medieval Karnataka'', Asian Educational Services, 1990, p.10</ref> The kadamba tree was considered a [[holy tree]] by the Kadamba dynasty.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kamat.com/kalranga/deccan/kadamba.htm |title=Kamat's Potpourri: The Deccan Plateau: The Kadambas |publisher=Kamat.com |date= |accessdate=2012-11-08}}</ref>
According to tradition the 27 [[nakshatra]]s, constituting 12 [[House (astrology)|Houses]] (Rasis) and nine [[planet]]s, are specifically represented precisely by 27 trees —one for each star. The kadamba tree is said to represent [[Shatabhisha]], roughly corresponding to [[Aquarius (constellation)|Aquarii]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chennaionline.com/astro/articles/yourstar.asp|title=Web Page Under Construction|author=|date=|website=chennaionline.com|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref>
=== Religious significance === {{multiple image | align = right | direction = vertical | width = 220 | image1 = Westindischer Maler um 1550 001.jpg | alt1 = | caption1 = [[Gita Govinda]] by [[Jayadeva]] | image2 = Indischer Maler um 1770 001.jpg | alt2 = | caption2 = Radha with Krishna }} Kadamba is mentioned in the ''[[Bhagavata Purana]]''. In [[North India]], it is associated with [[Krishna]] while in the south it is known as "[[Parvati]]’s tree". [[Radha]] and Krishna are supposed to have conducted their love play in the hospitable and sweet-scented shade of the kadamba tree.<ref>[http://iecolumnists.expressindia.comfull_column.php?content_id=71745. Kadamba vriksh]</ref> In the [[Sangam period]] of [[Tamil Nadu]], [[Murugan]] of Tirupparankundram Hill of [[Madurai]] was referred to as a centre of [[pantheism|nature worship]]. He was in the form of a spear under a kadamba tree.<ref>[http://ignca.nic.in/cd_08009.htm -Sacred Groves and Sacred Trees of Uttara Kannada]</ref>
An episode from the life of Krishna narrates of when he stole the garments of [[gopi]]s when they were bathing in a pond near [[Vrindavan]]. [[Varuna]], the sea-god, had forbidden nude bathing in rivers, ponds and other public places, but gopis often resorted to it. One day, to teach them a lesson, Krishna reached the bank of the pond where they were taking a bath and took away their garments and spread them on the branches of nearby kadamba tree. He himself climbed the tree and hid there behind a branch. After the gopis had bathed, they looked for their garments but found them missing. Suddenly their attention was drawn to the nearby kadamba tree by the stirring of its branches. When they looked up, they saw Krishna hiding there and their garments scattered all over the branches of the tree. Krishna insisted that they come out naked to receive their garments. This episode is portrayed in song, story, painting and artifacts, in the backdrop of the kadamba tree.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.exoticindiaart.com/product/DC90/|title=Vastra-harana|author=|date=|website=Exotic India|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref>
Karam-Kadamba is a popular harvest festival, celebrated on the eleventh lunar day of the month [[Bhadra (Hindu calendar)|Bhadra]]. A twig of the tree is brought and worshipped in the courtyard of the house. Later in the day, young ears of grain are distributed among friends and relatives. This festive custom has been adopted by the Tulu people. [[Onam]] ([[Kerala]]) and [[Huttari]] ([[Kodagu]]) are regional variants of this festival.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tulu-research.blogspot.com/2007_12_01_archive.html|title=TuLu Research & Studies|author=|date=|website=tulu-research.blogspot.com|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref> ''Kadambotsava'' ("The festival of Kadamba") is also the festival that is celebrated every year by the [[Government of Karnataka]] in honor of the Kadamba kingdom, the first ruling Kingdom of Karnataka, at [[Banavasi]], as it was here that the Kadamba kings organised the spring festival every year.<ref name="kadambotsava">''Kadambotsava'' {{cite news|title=Kadambotsava in Banavasi |url=http://www.hindu.com/2006/01/20/stories/2006012003990300.htm|author=Staff Correspondent|publisher=The Hindu|work=The Hindu, Friday, January 20, 2006 |accessdate=2006-11-28|location=Chennai, India|date=2006-01-20}}</ref>
The kadamba tree is also associated with a [[tree deity]] called Kadambariyamman.<ref name=TheHindu>{{citation |url=http://www.hinduonnet.com/thehindu/mp/2007/06/02/stories/2007060250410100.htm |publisher=The Hindu |title=Nature's unsung heroes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.khandro.net/nature_trees.htm|title=Trees|author=|date=|website=www.khandro.net|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref> The kadamba, which is considered the ''sthalavruksham'' ("tree of the place") of the city that is otherwise known as Kadambavanam (kadamba forest) and is present in [[Meenakshi Amman Temple]].<ref name=TheHindu/> A withered relic of the kadamba is also preserved there.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiadivine.org/audarya/hindu-sadhanas/176782-tripura-sundari-ashtakam.html|title=Tripura Sundari Ashtakam|author=|date=|website=IndiaDivine.org|accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref>
In [[Theravada|Theravada Buddhism]], the kadamba tree was where [[Sumedha Buddha]] achieved enlightenment.<ref>[[:si:අට විසි බුදුවරු]]</ref>
==See also== *''[[Nauclea orientalis]]'', the Leichhardt tree. A species commonly confused with the kadam tree.
== Notes == {{Reflist|33em}}
==References== * Bull. Mus. Natl. Hist. Nat., B, Adansonia '''6''': 247 (1984). * Pollard, J.F.,1969. A note on the nursery treatment of two species of Sabah. Malay.Forester 32(3), pp 269–271

Mus. Natl. Hist. Nat., B, Adansonia. 6: 247. 1985 |title=Flora of China online |volume=19 |author=Tao Chen and Charlotte M. Taylor}}
